# a blog post about how computer vision use in self-driving cars

The computer vision is a field of artificial intelligence that enables computers to interpret and make decisions based on visual data from the world. In self-driving cars, computer vision is used to analyze images and videos captured by cameras mounted on the vehicle. This technology allows the car to recognize objects such as pedestrians, other vehicles, traffic signs, and road markings, enabling it to navigate safely and efficiently.
